main_definition: Feeling uncertain, perplexed, or unable to understand something clearly.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Not knowing what one wants or believes in an ambiguous situation.
meanings_and_examples.example: After the unexpected announcement, she felt completely confused about her future career path.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Unable to make sense of a complex concept or idea.
meanings_and_examples.example: The complicated tax code left him feeling utterly confused and overwhelmed.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Mixed up or disoriented, typically as the result of something unexpected or sudden.
meanings_and_examples.example: When he switched jobs in his late 50s, everything felt confusing at first because he was used to one way of doing things.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Struggling with understanding two conflicting points of view or pieces of information.
meanings_and_examples.example: She was confused by the contradictory statements made by both politicians during the debate.
